page.title: 06WALKS
page.content: The area contains several pleasant {moorland walks.} One of which begins just opposite The Flouch Inn and proceeds southwards towards the{Porter or{Little Don}river. The banks of this river prove to be a popular picnic spot in the summer months. The area contains typical moorland plant species such as fescue grass, bracken, bilberry, ling, crowberry and bell heather. The woodland is mainly coniferous plantation containing Larch and Pine and some deciduous broad-leaved species such as oak, ash and sycamore. The western half of this area lies within the{Peak {National park.
